entry.title: Let's deploy BIP65 CHECKLOCKTIMEVERIFY!
entry.summary: The author of the context argues against the concept of "backwards compatibility" and explains why it does not make sense. They provide a link to their previous writing that explains their stance on the issue. The author also objects to the idea of soft forks and asserts that there is no consensus on the matter. They suggest either changing the specifications or doing nothing, as opposed to requiring everyone to agree for consensus changes.
